TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract serializable beforefieldinit TrackingExtract extends System.Object

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: The base class representing a field or a property to be extracted from a workflow instance and its associated annotations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]
TrackingExtract is the `abstract` base class from which the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityDataTrackingExtract> class and the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowDataTrackingExtract> class are derived. An <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityDataTrackingExtract> specifies a field or a property to be extracted from the activity associated with a tracking event and a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowDataTrackingExtract> specifies a field or a property to be extracted from the root activity of the workflow instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: When implemented in a derived class, initializes a new instance of the class.
When implemented in a derived class, gets the annotations associated with the extracted data.
Docs.value: The associated with the extracted data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Annotations are `strings` that you define that contain information to associate with the extracted data.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract string Member { get; set; }

Docs.summary: When implemented in a derived class, gets or sets the name of the field or property to be extracted.
Docs.value: The dot delineated name of a field or a property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Member can be set to specify a field or a property; a member of a field or a property; or a single element of a field or a property (or a member of either) that implements the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface. For example, a single element in an `array` may be specified.
